docs.snippet: Uruguayan authorities rept that May 11 collision and subsequent fire involving Brit freighter Royston Grange and Liberian tanker Tien Chee has resulted in 84 deaths; add they are still unable to account for 9 crewmen and pilot of Tien Chee

headline.main: 84 DEAD IN COLLISION OFF URUGUAY COAST

docs.snippet: Uruguayan Parliament on May 15 votes, 68-56, to extend mo-old 'state of internal war' against Tupamaros for 45 days

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 16 (AP) -- President Juan M. Bordaberry signed a declaration today extending Uruguay's "internal war" against the leftist Tupamaro guerrillas for 45 days.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 16 (AP) -- President Juan M. Bordaberry signed a declaration today extending Uruguay's "internal war" against the leftist Tupamaro guerrillas for 45 days.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Pres Bordaberry on May 16 extends 'war' against Tupamaros for 45 days; measure voids const rights in areas with substantial guerrilla activity, authorizes searches and arrests without ct authorization, orders suspects to mil cts and imposes severe press censorship

docs.snippet: Tupamaros on May 16 reptdly free N Bardesio, police photographer kidnapped last Feb and who is said to have admitted that he belonged to police 'death squad'

docs.snippet: LEONID ILYICH BREZHNEV, the general secretary of the Soviet Communist party, told an interviewer recently that he sometimes has trouble falling asleep. "You know," he said, "the problems of the day don't stop spinning in my head at night. And there...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEONID ILYICH BREZHNEV, the general secretary of the Soviet Communist party, told an interviewer recently that he sometimes has trouble falling asleep. "You know," he said, "the problems of the day don't stop spinning in my head at night. And there are quite a few problems in a country as vast as ours.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 27 -- Security forces smashed into a "people's jail" early today and freed two kidnapping victims held for more than a year by the leftist Tupamaro guerrillas.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 27 -- Security forces smashed into a "people's jail" early today and freed two kidnapping victims held for more than a year by the leftist Tupamaro guerrillas.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan security forces smash into 'people's jail,' May 27, and free hostages C F Davie and U Pereira Reverbel held by Tupamaro guerrillas for over a yr; Pereira Reverbel is head of state telephone co, Davie is former agr min; several guerrillas reptdly captured

headline.main: Uruguay Frees Two Held by Tupamaros

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, May 28 -- "Buy your needs before the hippopotamus takes them away." So goes the slogan of Minimax, Argentina's biggest supermarket chain.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, May 28 -- "Buy your needs before the hippopotamus takes them away." So goes the slogan of Minimax, Argentina's biggest supermarket chain.
docs.abstract: effects of inflation on typical Argentine worker and small businessmen discussed; shortage of jobs in Buenos Aires resulting from heavy migration from provinces abets crisis; illus of supermkt urging consumers to buy immediately to beat inflation

headline.main: Inflation Nibbles at Argentines' Paychecks; Inflation Is Nibbling Hungrily At Paychecks of Argentines

docs.snippet: BECKENHAM, England, June 13 (AP) -- Pancho Gonzales and Torben Ulrich, two old-timers by tennis standards, were star performers at the Kent grass tournament today.

headline.main: GONZALES, ULRICH SHOW AGING SKILL; Pancho Defeats Seewagen, Dane Wins 2 Matches

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 2 -- Attacks by the Tupamaro revolutionary guerrilla movement, counterviolence by the right wing and a combination of inflation and stagnation are fraying the durable fabric of Uruguayan democracy.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 2 -- Attacks by the Tupamaro revolutionary guerrilla movement, counterviolence by the right wing and a combination of inflation and stagnation are fraying the durable fabric of Uruguayan democracy.
docs.abstract: Article on pol and econ effects of Tupamaro revolution in Uruguay and response to situation by Pres J M Bordaberry revs history of revolt and discusses destruction of Uruguayan democracy and resulting conditions of inflation and stagnation which can only be overcome by ending armed subversion and achieving natl consensus and confidence in sustained govt; over 30 people have been killed between Mar 1 and June 2, '72, making security dominant issue of Bordaberry's 1st mos in office; over 500 Tupamaros and collaborators, including many academic and professional people, are being held in mil prisons, supposedly more secure than natl penitentiary; prison escapes and other incidents revd; security forces have discovered Tupamaro underground operation centers and have seized documents and over 500 weapons; bad econ condition of rural areas, which produce country's most vital exports, is main reason Uruguay is in serious financial trouble; econ statistics and reactions of some businessmen noted; Econ Min F Forteza, traveling abroad in search of sources of revenue to meet treasury deficit of about $100-million in foreign payments, says Uruguay must adopt coherent econ program; crisis is caused by disagreement among farmers, labor, industrialists, bankers, and others over what such a program should be; econ history of country revd; Educ Min and Pres adviser J M Sanguinetti says results of last election show that Uruguayan democracy is more powerful than previously thought; illus

headline.main: Life in Uruguay Disrupted By Violence and Inflation; Life in Uruguay Is Disrupted by Violence and Inflation

byline.original: By JUAN de ONISSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BECKENHAM, England, June 15 (AP) -- Bill Lloyd, a 23-yearold Australian, defeated 44year-old Pancho Gonzalez of the United States, 4-6, 6-1, 7-5, in the Kent tennis tournament today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BECKENHAM, England, June 15 (AP) -- Bill Lloyd, a 23-yearold Australian, defeated 44year-old Pancho Gonzalez of the United States, 4-6, 6-1, 7-5, in the Kent tennis tournament today.
